Token.Abstract: KKScene is the scene class used in Kobold Kit projects. KKScene updates the controllers and behaviors, receives and dispatches events (input, physics).

The number of frames rendered since the start of the app. Useful if you need to lock your game's update cycle to the framerate. For example this allows you to perform certain actions n frames from now, instead of n seconds.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The number of frames rendered since the start of the app. Useful if you need to lock your game's update cycle to the framerate. For example this allows you to perform certain actions n frames from now, instead of n seconds.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The number of frames rendered since the start of the app. Useful if you need to lock your game's update cycle to the framerate. For example this allows you to perform certain actions n frames from now, instead of n seconds.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The number of frames rendered since the start of the app. Useful if you need to lock your game's update cycle to the framerate. For example this allows you to perform certain actions n frames from now, instead of n seconds.

Token.Abstract: Registers a class as generic input receiver. Implement the usual input event methods on the receiver. Note: this is a preliminary, inefficient system. It will eventually be replaced.

Parameter.Name: receiver
Parameter.Abstract: Any object that implements touch, mouse, or other input events.

Token.Abstract: Unregisters a class as generic input receiver.

Parameter.Name: receiver
Parameter.Abstract: An object that was previously registered as input receiver.

Token.Abstract: Dumps the scene graph to a string.

Parameter.Name: options
Parameter.Abstract: Determines what will be included in the dump.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A string containing the textual dump of the scene graph.
